channel.title: How to turn a Clock divider into a clock multiplyer?
channel.description: Hey Guys :) I have been using this clock divider and it is useful in many situations. **- But I was wondering how I could turn it into a clock multiplyer instead?** I did a google search and found out it might be possible with a flip flop but i wasn't able to make it work. Any Help appreciated :) Clock1.axs (5.1 KB)

item.title: How to turn a Clock divider into a clock multiplyer?
item.dc:creator: @anon5189335
item.description:
@anon5189335 wrote:

Hey

I tried a different approach, but it doesn't work on midi clock, ONLY when using an LFO as a clock. There might be a little bit of drift when you set a dial to +60, but I am not sure about that yet. If you notice anything, please let me know.

Try this one:
Pitchdivider.axp (5.3 KB)

Johannes suggested setting it up in a simpler way, like this. Havent tried Johannes version yet, though:

Read full topic
item.source: How to turn a Clock divider into a clock multiplyer?

item.title: How to turn a Clock divider into a clock multiplyer?
item.dc:creator: @mackemint Markus Kaczmarek
item.description:
@mackemint wrote:

I had a go at it with the timer/timeri-object but didn't have too much time to invest in the matter. Assuming the object outputs time in milliseconds, I could measure the time between two pulses, then do (time/2)^-1 to control the frequency of an LFO object.. Please share if u get any longer than me!

Read full topic
item.source: How to turn a Clock divider into a clock multiplyer?

item.title: How to turn a Clock divider into a clock multiplyer?
item.dc:creator: @alex alex
item.description:
@alex wrote:

impossible, since you'd need to look into the future.
But what you could do is calculate the time between 2 triggers, convert it to frequency (multiply it by 1 ,2,4,...) and use that to drive a new pulse.

Read full topic
item.source: How to turn a Clock divider into a clock multiplyer?

@anon5189335 wrote:

Hey Guys

I have been using this clock divider and it is useful in many situations.

- But I was wondering how I could turn it into a clock multiplyer instead?

I did a google search and found out it might be possible with a flip flop but i wasn't able to make it work.

Any Help appreciated
